ground_truth_bugs.description: Conditional passkey UI not set up for initial login when user is null - breaks ID-less passkey authentication
ground_truth_bugs.details: The PR changes isConditionalPasskeysEnabled() to require user != null, but on initial login context.getUser() is null. The original code set up passkey UI when user was null; the new code doesn't.

golden_false_positives.reasoning: This comment is unclear and doesn't describe a real bug. The method isConditionalPasskeysEnabled(UserModel user) IS called with a parameter (context.getUser()). The comment seems to be a poorly worded version of the second golden comment about user being null.

analysis_notes: All 3 droid comments were false positives about potential NPE when webauthnAuth is null, but they failed to read the isConditionalPasskeysEnabled() method which already checks webauthnAuth != null. The droid completely missed the actual behavioral regression - that conditional passkey UI is no longer set up for initial login (when user is null), breaking ID-less passkey authentication. One golden comment (the detailed one) correctly identified this regression.
